name: biomni-analyze-crispr-genome-editing
title: Biomni: Analyze Crispr Genome Editing
description: Analyze CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing results by comparing original and edited sequences
content:
Overview

This tool performs comprehensive analysis of CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing experiments by comparing original and edited DNA sequences. It identifies the cut site, analyzes editing outcomes (insertions, deletions, substitutions), evaluates guide RNA effectiveness, and assesses homology-directed repair (HDR) efficiency when a repair template is provided. The tool provides detailed metrics on editing precision and success rates.

Input Parameters

  • original_sequence (string): Path to file containing the original DNA sequence, or the DNA sequence string itself
  • edited_sequence (string): Path to file containing the edited DNA sequence, or the DNA sequence string itself
  • guide_rna (string): CRISPR guide RNA (crRNA) sequence targeting the genomic region
  • repair_template (string, optional): Homology-directed repair template sequence for precise editing

Input Format

Sequences can be provided as files or direct strings:

Guide RNA example: "GTTGCCCCACAGGGCAGTAA"

Original sequence (file or string):
ATCGATCGATCGGTTGCCCCACAGGGCAGTAAATCGATCGATCG

Edited sequence (file or string):
ATCGATCGATCGGTTGC----CAGGGCAGTAAATCGATCGATCG

Repair template (optional):
ATCGATCGATCGGTTGCGGGCAGGGCAGTAAATCGATCGATCG

Biological Use Case

Essential for evaluating CRISPR editing experiments including: gene knockout studies, validation of sgRNA design, assessment of HDR vs NHEJ repair outcomes, optimization of editing conditions, and characterization of off-target effects. Particularly useful for therapeutic genome editing research where precision is critical.

Output

Generates a comprehensive analysis report (crispr_editing_analysis.txt) containing: cut site identification and PAM sequence location, detailed mutation analysis (type, position, size), editing efficiency metrics, HDR success rate (when repair template provided), sequence alignments showing changes, and quality assessment of the editing outcome.

Category

genetics
